meanings.definition: Take (a machine or structure) to pieces.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic will dismantle the old car engine to fix it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to dismantle the broken clock carefully to avoid losing any parts.
meanings.sent3: Why did the robot want to dismantle itself just to see how it worked?
meanings.sent4: She felt like her heart was being dismantled piece by piece after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to dismantle the bomb quickly to save the city.

meanings.definition: Strip (a building or machine) of its covering or fittings.
meanings.sent1: The workers will dismantle the old house to renovate it.
meanings.sent2: It's necessary to dismantle the computer to clean out the dust inside.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to dismantle his hat to find the missing rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to dismantle the trees of their leaves in one night.
meanings.sent5: She had to dismantle the layers of lies to uncover the truth.

meanings.sent1: The engineer will dismantle the robot to repair its circuit.
meanings.sent2: It's easier to dismantle the furniture before moving it to the new house.
meanings.sent3: The kids wanted to dismantle the sandcastle to build a new one.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting seemed to dismantle reality into abstract shapes.
meanings.sent5: He had to dismantle the old radio to find the source of the static.
